meanings.definition: The spreading out of something in a shape resembling a fan.
meanings.sent1: The fanout of the fireworks display was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The fanout of the peacock's feathers was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The fanout of the cake's frosting made it look like a colorful fan.
meanings.sent4: The fanout of the dancers on stage created a beautiful fan of movement.
meanings.sent5: The fanout of the tree branches created a natural canopy above us.

meanings.definition: The number of outputs a signal is sent to in a digital circuit.
meanings.sent1: The electronic device had a high fanout to connect to multiple devices.
meanings.sent2: The computer chip's fanout allowed it to communicate with various components.
meanings.sent3: The robot's fanout was so high that it could control many gadgets at once.
meanings.sent4: The network's fanout resembled a spider's web, connecting everything efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The satellite's fanout enabled it to transmit data to different locations.

meanings.definition: To spread out in a shape resembling a fan.
meanings.sent1: She began to fanout the cards in her hand to see them clearly.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's skirt started to fanout as she twirled on stage.
meanings.sent3: He decided to fanout the papers on his desk to organize them better.
meanings.sent4: The paintbrush strokes fanout beautifully on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The petals of the flower fanout elegantly, showcasing their vibrant colors.
